result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven C Spencer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. Defendant will plead Guilty to count 1 in 22CF151, Guilty to count 1 & 2 in 22cf282 and all remaining charges to be dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Venema is withdrawing motion hearing set for 22CF343 and states there is a global resolution. Atty Venema states his client is satisfied by taking plea by video. Court asked Defendant if he would like to be brought over and enter the plea in person. Defendant wishes to enter plea by video, Court is satisfied and continues with plea hearing. 

Atty Venema stipulates to prior convictions on enhancements.  

SEH set for 12/5/22 @ 11 am
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. 
Parties agree trial should be removed and track to Motion hearing date of 10/27/22
So ordered by the court.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.
Notice of Bail/Bond forfeiture. Bond set 2-28-2022

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody by video. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Prior bond forfeited. New total bond set. Future dates remain. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF632, 22CF151, 22CF282, & 21CM237

DEFENDANT MUST NOT DRIVE AT ALL. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2867 thru 2872
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Steven C Spencer in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:38 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status hearing on 22CF151. Case 21CM237 also on the call, but should not be as this case is set for trial before Judge Johnson and shall remain as scheduled. Record by Atty. Venema as to quick status hearing and need to put matter out to obtain discovery, offer. Further record and withdrawal of speedy trial demand. Court sets as requested. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Demanded by Defense

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven C Spencer in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Keith Venema. Denied. Bond Remains. State is objecting to bond modification. Cancel 5/26 date. Speedy trial demanded by defense. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
2:08 PM (64-06) Plaintiff State of Wisconsin by ADA Herrmann in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Steven C Spencer. Defendant Steven C Spencer appeared by video. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Venema acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty on behalf of his client.

2:11 PM

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Steven C Spencer appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney Keith Kolby Venema for Steven C Spencer appeared in court. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Keith Venema
Keith Venema

Defendant Steven Christopher Spencer appeared in court, in custody by video. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Caleb Tomaszewski appeared specially. Motion to modify bond by defendant, denied. Bond remains. Defendant filed pro se motion to modify bond. State has complaint prepared, just need agency to swear to complaint Defendant's wife is present in court. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Bond Modification/Reduction
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. NOT TO DRIVE AT ALL. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-981 thru 22-983 & 22-992 thru 22-994
